title: Kled + Urgot Lore
body:
Urgot has become tired of Zaun, he has taken Ekko under his wing, slain all the self proclaimed great ones under their false sense of strength ({{champion:112}} {{champion:126}})
He found those who were strong, who could survive, and slain everyone else in his path
Now, is his time to revisit those who imprisoned him in the first place, and he's out for vengeance (against {{champion:50}})
He cuts the throats of all who don't listen to him, and it's time.
Back in Noxus, he "guns" straight for the one who took him down to the place that imprisoned him, spreading the pollution that showed true strength in Zaun before everyone in his path, slaying all who are not worthy ({{champion:119}} gets his ass beat :)) putting himself before {{champion:50}}  and {{champion:122}} , the journey will be worth it

KLED %%%%% PART
{{champion:240}} is enjoying his property, and hears muffled screams and chem-gas in the distance, low on taco fuel and annoyed by Skaarl farting he goes straight in waiting to "CHAAAAAAAAAARGE!" at those who dare disturb him and his Skaarl. Smelling the chem-gas, he only laughs, incapable for smell to harm thou who endures Skaarl's farts. Looking at the blood bath, he looks at it as an opportunity, placing "KLEDS PROPERTY" flags all over the place.
Wandering through the trail of 6 circular footprints, he see's {{champion:6}} {{champion:245}} and the rest of what he could only assume were Zaunites, slowly taunting {{champion:50}},{{champion:122}, and the rest of the Noxus army as they get curbstomped into the dirt, Urgot has judged Noxus weak, and plans to overthrow them all and turn the scraps who survived, into powerful members of his crew. But Kled wasn't having any of it, he screams, "THAT BIRD IS MY SKAARL'S DINNER!", Urgot slowly turns around, laughing right in Kled's face, his psychotic anger knows no bounds at this moment, he screams "CHAAAAAAAAAARGE!" and jumps straight into all of them, {{champion:50}} and {{champion:122}} cling to the last sign of life they have, {{champion:240}} ready to die rather than back down, ruthlessly attacking {{champion:6}}, 
ANDDDD THATS ALL I GOT

replies.body:
Ekko would never ever join Urgot. He wants Zaun to become a better place for the poor and weak, he would definitely hate Urgots philosophy of social darwinism.

They are on complete different sides of the moral spectrum.

What Urgot might say to this: [Belief is like steel. The stronger it is, the easier it is to break. ](https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/1/15/Urgot.tauntEnemyEkko.ogg/revision/latest?cb=20170918211618)

> [{quoted}](name=SatomiKun,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=1EMv3kAn,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-01-19T03:49:19.384+0000)
>
> Ekko would never ever join Urgot. He wants Zaun to become a better place for the poor and weak, he would definitely hate Urgots philosophy of social darwinism.
> 
> They are on complete different sides of the moral spectrum.

Yeah as an Ekko fanboy this triggered TF out of me. Ekko is a leader, not a follower in any sense which is why he speaks against {{champion:126}} and {{champion:112}}.

I feel if anything, they would be very interesting ennemies because Ekko always rewinded to try to solve things and help the weak "survive" but sometime he failed.

While Urgot is one that live upon the philosophy "If you died, you weren't worthy anyway. You must survive, it is surviving the pain and violence of life that show your character."

For him, the ones Ekko save are certainly not worthy but Ekko who almost die and endure pain endlessly, he get a taste of what Urgot endured by himself with no rewind, no save thing. Urgot got broken and survived.

I am quite sure they would face each other, the same way I feel Ekko would encounter Warwick and how Urgot would encounter Warwick too.


But honestly, Ekko x Urgot is my favorite interaction/kind of dynamic.

Interesting for sure, but you would need to bridge the gap between Ekko being a beacon of Zaun excellence to joining Urgot.

At a recent panel one of Riots writers said in regards to Ekko he is relatively early in his "heroes journey" and he hasn't had his "Uncle Ben moment yet" suggesting that his parents might die.

That could be a good motivation for him to become disillusioned and more pliable by Urgot. Privy to making him believe that it was irrelevant that his parents were "good people" because by Urgots philosophy they were weak and because of that couldn't protect themselves and now Ekko can learn from that by compromising some of his values to prioritize strength in order to survive long enough to make Zaun a better place.

A bit like Danys' character in Game of Thrones starts out as a hopeless optimist idealist ,but then confronted with the harsh realities of being a ruler, is forced to drop some of her values to maintain control of the Slave cities in Essos.

Something to that effect could work
